item.title: How to Spend Less Time on YouTube - Self control for addiction
item.description: Maybe I'm paranoid, but I think there's a lot of smart people out there dedicating their life's work to make others keep watching videos. Since YouTube's incomprehensible decision to remove dislikes count it's become even easier to waste time on worthless content. In this blog post, I'll describe a simple trick that helped me start using YouTube in a more deliberate and focused manner.
item.author: (Paweł Urbanek)

item.title: Creating personalised data stories with GPT-3
item.description: You can tell powerful stories with data, but so often we are faced with raw data (albeit beautifully presented), and are left to create our own narratives. My previous attempts at turning data into stories have been time consuming and underwhelming. In this post I demonstrate how GPT-3, a new and advanced language model, can construct engaging and unique stories from user-specific data, with relative ease.
item.author: (Colin Eberhardt)

item.title: Using CRTP to your advantage: Simplifying overloaded Windows Runtime method projections in C++/WinRT
item.description: C++/WinRT uses the so-called the curiously recurring template pattern, commonly known as CRTP. One of the nice features of CRTP is that the derived class method signature does not have to be a perfect match for the signature expected by the base class.
item.author: (Raymond Chen)

item.title: Introduction to Open Policy Agent (OPA) - Pradeep Loganathan
item.description: The Open Policy Agent (OPA) is a CNCF project, to build declarative policies that can be run by the admission controller. It is a lightweight authorization engine that fits well in Kubernetes ecosystem.
item.author: (https://www.facebook.com/pradeepl/)

item.title: Kubernetes Cluster API (CAPI) - An introduction - Pradeep Loganathan
item.description: The Cluster API(CAPI) is a consistent, declarative API enabling broader use cases such as hybrid-cloud and multi-cloud. It allows providers to implement platform specific Intrinsics in a standardized manner. It allows for the development of standardized tooling interacting with a standardized interface eliminating provider and tooling lock-in.
item.author: (https://www.facebook.com/pradeepl/)

item.title: HTMX With ASP.NET Core
item.description: With all the momentum behind frontend frameworks, it’s often easy to forget that server-side rendering (SSR) is a mature approach to delivering fast and reliable user experiences. Unfortunately, one of the most significant drawbacks to frontend development is the experience can vary wildly depending on factors beyond our control, with the client doing much of the heavy lifting building the experience for the users.
